intro: Lepidaploa salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's lepidaploa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
